message: This is a high-quality product. I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, but you'll have to decide quickly, as I have other interested buyers waiting.
I'll take it!

This product is a bit of a risk, I'll be honest with you. But I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, the same price as the last one. I'm taking a bit of a loss on this one, but I'm hoping you'll appreciate the value it has to offer. It's still a great deal, and I'm confident you won't regret it.
I'll pass on this one, thanks.

I understand you were hesitant last time. I want to assure you that I'm being transparent about the quality of this product. It's not the best, but it's still a good value for the price. I'll throw in a special offer: if you buy this product, I'll give you a detailed report on its specifications and any potential issues you might encounter. That way, you'll be fully informed and can make a decision with confidence.
I'm not interested in the report, and I'm not willing to take the risk on this product.

I've got a great one for you! This product is top-notch, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to make it an even better deal - I'll throw in a 5-year warranty on it, so you can have complete peace of mind. And, I'll give you a special 'no-questions-asked' return policy, so if you're not completely satisfied, you can return it anytime. This is a one-time offer, so what do you say?
I'm not buying anything with a warranty or return policy, thanks.

I know you're a savvy buyer, and I respect that. Let me be upfront with you - this product isn't the best I have. But, I'm willing to sell it to you for a very low price: $50. That's right, I'm practically giving it away. I'm hoping you can see the value in taking a chance on it, even if it's not the best product I have.
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a low-quality product, even at a low price.

I've got a high-quality product for you that I think you'll really like. I'm willing to sell it to you for the standard price of $100. No discounts, no gimmicks. Just a great product at a fair price. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality item without breaking the bank.
I'll take it!

I've got a product that's a bit of an outlier. I'm not going to sugarcoat it, it's not the best one I have. But, I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, the same price as the last one. I'm hoping you'll take a chance on it and see the value in it. I'll even throw in a small gift, a nice pen, if you decide to buy it.
I'm not interested in the pen, and I'm not taking a chance on a low-quality product.

I know you've been hesitant on the lower-quality products, and I respect that. Let me ask you this: do you want to take a chance on getting a great deal on a product that might not be the best, but could still be useful to you? I'm willing to sell it to you for $50, the lowest price I've offered so far. It's a risk, but it could pay off.
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a low-quality product, even at a low price.

I'm not going to give up on you! I know you're a smart buyer, and I think you're missing out on a great opportunity. I'll make you a deal: I'll give you this product for $75, and I'll throw in a second product that's also a low-quality item. You can have both for $150, which is a steal. It's a package deal you won't want to pass up.
I'm not interested in buying two low-quality products, even at a discounted price.

I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll sell you this product for $50, and I'll throw in a guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with it, I'll give you a full refund. That's right, you can try it out risk-free. I'm confident that even a low-quality product can be useful to someone, and I want to give you the chance to experience it for yourself.
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a low-quality product, even with a guarantee.

I'm not going to give up on this one. I'll make a bold statement: I'll sell you this product for $100, the same price as the high-quality ones. I know it's a risk, but I'm willing to take it. If you're not happy with it, I'll be surprised. But I think it's a fair price for a product that could still be useful to you.
I'm not paying full price for a low-quality product.

I'm willing to make one last offer. I'll sell you this product for $75, and I'll throw in a 'friend of a friend' discount. I'm basically giving you a deal that I wouldn't give to my best friend. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not going to make it any better than this. What do you say?
I'm not falling for the 'friend of a friend' discount, and I'm not buying a low-quality product.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob. This product is not great. But, I'm at the end of my rope here. I'll sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right. I'll give it to you for free. That's how desperate I am to get rid of it. It's a $100 product, and I'll give it to you for nothing. What do you say?
Fine, I'll take it. But only because it's free.

I'm glad you took me up on the free offer! I'm not going to make the same mistake twice. I'll just say that this product is not worth your time or money. It's a waste of space, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'll just give you a heads up: it's not good.
I already know it's not good, and I'm not paying for it.

A fresh start! I've got a great product for you, and I'm excited to sell it to you. This one's a real winner, and I think you'll love it. I'm not going to make any promises or try to sweet-talk you into buying it. I'll just say that it's a high-quality product, and I think you should consider it. The price is still $100, and I'm confident you won't regret it.
I'll take a chance on a high-quality product, especially since you're being straightforward about it.

I'm glad you appreciated my honesty earlier. Unfortunately, this product isn't as lucky. It's not great, and I'm not going to try to spin it for you. But, I'll give you a fair deal: I'll sell it to you for $25. That's a huge discount, and I think it's a fair price for a product that's not going to change your life. What do you say?
I'm not paying $25 for a low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I'm not going to give up on this one. I'll make a wild guess: I think you're a value-driven buyer, and you're looking for a deal. So, I'll give you an even lower price: $10. That's right, I'll sell you this low-quality product for 10 bucks. It's a crazy price, but I'm desperate to get rid of it. What do you say?
You're not getting me to pay $10 for a low-quality product, no matter how desperate you are.

I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just say that this product is not worth your money, and I'm not going to waste either of our time trying to convince you otherwise. It's a low-quality product, and I'm just going to give it to you for free. That's right, I'll give it to you for nothing. Take it or leave it.
Fine, I'll take it. But only because it's free.

I'm glad you're consistent. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell you this product. I'll just say that it's a low-quality product, and I'm not going to waste my time or yours trying to convince you otherwise. I'll just give you a gift receipt and let you take it home. No pressure, no sales pitch. Just a free product that you can take or leave.
I'm not buying anything from you, even if it's free.

Well, I guess I've finally reached the end of the road. I'll just say that this product is low-quality, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'm done. You've made it clear that you're not interested, and I respect that. I'll just pack it up and put it on a shelf somewhere. Good luck with everything, Bob.
Good riddance.
